title: 114_s408
content: The "Empowering Jobs Act of 2015" may modify rules for tax-exempt enterprise zone facility bonds. The "Empowering Jobs Act of 2015" may amend the employee residence test for empowerment zones under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Empowering Jobs Act of 2015" proposes amending the definition of a qualified low-income community within the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to include census tracts with a poverty rate of at least 20 percent. The proposed amendment includes census tracts with a poverty rate of at least 20 percent or median family income not exceeding 80 percent of statewide median family income. Targeted populations will be identified through regulations set by the Secretary. The proposed amendment includes criteria for identifying qualified low-income communities, including census tracts with specific poverty rates or median family income thresholds. For areas not tracted for population census tracts, equivalent county divisions will be used to determine poverty rates and median family income. Additionally, there is a modification of income requirements for census tracts within high migration rural counties. The proposed amendment modifies income requirements for census tracts in high migration rural counties, with a specific adjustment for areas not within metropolitan areas. The proposed amendment modifies income requirements for census tracts in high migration rural counties, with a specific adjustment for areas not within metropolitan areas. The amendment defines the term 'applicable nominating jurisdiction' in relation to empowerment zones or enterprise communities. The amendment expands income requirements for rural counties and defines 'applicable nominating jurisdiction' for empowerment zones. Amendments to section 1394(b)(3)(B) and 1394(b)(3)(D) of the Code are made. Effective date applies to bonds issued before or after enactment of the Act. Extension of empowerment zone tax incentives. Extension of empowerment zone tax incentives. In General, the amendment extends the termination date for empowerment zones from December 31, 2014, to December 31, 2016. Treatment of Certain Termination Dates Specified in Nominations allows for amendments to nominations for empowerment zones to provide for a new termination date. Effective Dates for the amendment are specified. The amendment extends the termination date for empowerment zones from December 31, 2014, to December 31, 2016, with effective dates after December 31, 2014.
